Stephanie Hime, Director of Elementary Curriculum & Instruction
OSRCL CPARP: Clinton Parents as Reading Partners
About Clinton Parents As Reading Partners

div.p: *National Merit Scholars *Oklahoma Academic All State Scholars *Gates Millennium Scholars *Concurrent Enrollment *Career Tech Enrollment *Average yearly scholarships awarded: $500,00
*Marching and Concert Bands, Color Guard *Choir *Legal Team *Robotics *11 Athletic Teams *FCCLA *Vocational Agriculture *Student Council *Student Broadcasting *Special Olympics
*CPSF Annual Grants to Teachers *Teacher of the Year Award *Local Business Support *Multiple Local Scholarships
*100% Graduation *Create well-informed, responsible and engaged citizens
*3 Elementary Schools *1 Middle School *1 High School *Tiny Tornadoes Daycare *STEAM/Makerspace at each campus

img.alt: Clinton Public Schools has purchased Footsteps to Brilliance reading program that is free to any resident in the 73601 zipcode. It toggles between English and Spanish

span.span: Clinton Public Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated groups. For inquiries about this policy contact the Assistant Superintendent, Clinton Public Schools, 1720 Opal Avenue, Clinton, OK 73601. Telephone: (580) 323-1800.
